actions.text: The sea fury targets one frightened creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or drop to 0 hit points.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Sea Fury can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Sea Fury regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: As Water
legendary_actions.text: The sea fury transforms into a wave of foaming seawater, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying, and moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. While in this form, it can't be grappled or restrained. It reverts to its true form at the end of this movement.

legendary_actions.name: Fearsome Apparition (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The sea fury conjures an apparition of one of its dead sisters, which appears in an unoccupied space the sea fury can see within 30 feet of it. Enemies of the sea fury that can see the apparition must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it until it vanishes at the end of the sea fury's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Conjure Snakes (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The sea fury disgorges a swarm of poisonous snakes, which occupies the same space as the sea fury, acts on its own initiative count, and attacks as directed by the sea fury. The sea fury can control up to three of these swarms at a time.

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the shadowghast must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to this Stench for 24 hours.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadowghast can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The shadowghast makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.text: Sken counts as one size larger when determining her carrying capacity and the weight she can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Sken wears a ring of obscuring. With it, she can cast the fog cloud spell centered on herself three times per day. The cloud lasts for 1 minute (no concentration required).

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage when used with two hands.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The basilisk can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Petrifying Secretions
traits.text: A creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if it hits the basilisk with a weapon attack while within 5 feet of it or if it starts its turn grappled by the basilisk. Unless the save succeeds, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The basilisk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 12).

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the udaak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from the udaak and knocked prone.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The udaak deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The udaak makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its slam.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 21). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the udaak can't bite another target.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
The udaak makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the udaak, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the udaak's turns.

If the udaak takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the udaak must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the udaak. If the udaak dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

traits.name: Voice Lock
traits.text: The vox seeker must move toward and attack the source of the nearest voice within 60 feet of it, to the exclusion of all other targets, for as long as it remains operational.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The vox seeker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage plus 3 lightning damage.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: Yinra has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: Yinra has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.text: If a creature tries to read Belashyrra's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Eye Thief
traits.text: Belashyrra can see through the eyes of all creatures within 120 feet of it. It can use its Eye Ray through any creature within 120 feet of it, as though it were in that creature's space.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Belashyrra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Belashyrra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Belashyrra regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Belashyrra dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Teleport
traits.text: As a bonus action, Belashyrra can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Belashyrra makes two attacks with its claws and uses its Eye Ray once.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Eye Ray
actions.text:
Belashyrra shoots one of the following magical eye rays of its choice, targeting one creature it can see within 120 feet of it:

• 1. Psyche-Reconstruction Ray. The target must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw, taking 49 (9d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it dies and transforms into a spectator under Belashyrra's control and acts immediately after Belashyrra in the initiative order. The target can't be returned to its original form by any means short of a wish spell.
• 2. Domination Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by Belashyrra for 1 minute or until the target takes damage. Belashyrra can issue telepathic commands to the charmed creature (no action required), which it does its best to obey.
• 3. Mind-Weakening Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw or take 36 (8d8) psychic damage and be unable to cast spells or activate magic items for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 4. Blinding Ray. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) radiant damage and be blinded for 1 minute. Until this blindness ends, Belyshyrra can see through the blinded creature's eyes. The blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Belashyrra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Belashyrra regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.text: Belashyrra makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Implant Fear (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Belashyrra targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) psychic damage and immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from Belashyrra.

legendary_actions.name: Rend Reality (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Belashyrra rips at the bonds of reality in its immediate area. Each creature within 10 feet of Belashyrra must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) force damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

traits.name: Commander of Bones
traits.text: As a bonus action, the knight can target one skeleton or zombie it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must obey the knight's commands until the knight dies or until the knight releases it as a bonus action. The knight can command up to twelve undead at a time this way.

traits.name: Master of the Pallid Banner
traits.text: While within 60 feet of the knight, any undead ally of the knight has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The knight attacks twice with one of its weapons.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Change Appearance
traits.text: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The changeling makes two attacks with its dagger.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: Each creature within 30 feet of the changeling must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The clawfoot has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the clawfoot's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the clawfoot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The clawfoot makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If the dolgaunt is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dolgaunt instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.text: While the dolgaunt is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dolgaunt makes two tentacle attacks and two unarmed strikes. Up to two tentacle attacks can be replaced by Vitality Drain.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 12) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the dolgaunt can't use the same tentacle on another target. The dolgaunt has two tentacles.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Vitality Drain
actions.text: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the dolgaunt must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the dolgaunt regains a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

traits.name: Dual Consciousness
traits.text: The dolgrim has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dolgrim makes three attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The hag makes two Nightmare Touch attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Touch
actions.text: ms +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is unconscious, it takes an extra 10 (3d6) psychic damage and is cursed until the hag dies or the curse is removed. The cursed creature's hit point maximum decreases by 5 (1d10) whenever it finishes a long rest.

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.text: If a creature tries to read Dyrrn's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Dyrrn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Dyrrn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Dyrrn regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If Dyrrn takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Dyrrn dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Teleport
traits.text: As a bonus action, Dyrrn can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Dyrrn makes one Tentacle Whip attack and uses its Corruption once. Dyrrn can replace its Tentacle Whip attack with Extract Brain if it has a creature grappled.

actions.name: Tentacle Whip
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 23), pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Dyrrn, and must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends. Dyrrn can't use the same tentacle whip on another target until this grapple ends. Dyrrn has two tentacle whips.

actions.name: Corruption
actions.text:
Dyrrn targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (4d6 + 8) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute.

A corrupted creature's flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature grappled by Dyrrn. On hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Dyrrn kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Dyrrn can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Dyrrn regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle Whip
legendary_actions.text: Dyrrn makes one attack with its Tentacle Whip.

legendary_actions.name: Spawn Aberration (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Dyrrn regurgitates an intellect devourer in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The intellect devourer is under Dyrrn's control and acts immediately after Dyrrn in the initiative order.

legendary_actions.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Dyrrn magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or take 30 (5d8 + 8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Expeditious Messenger
languages: one language spoken by its creator

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The messenger doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.text: While the messenger is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Quickness (recharge 5-6)
traits.text: The fastieth can take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The quori uses its Mind Thrust twice.

actions.name: Idyllic Touch
actions.text: ms +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall prone in a fit of laughter.

actions.name: Mind Thrust
actions.text: The quori targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Possession (recharge on 6)
actions.text:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

traits.name: Dual Mind
traits.text: The Inspired has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

actions.name: Crysteel Dagger
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip)
actions.text: The Inspired unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the Inspired, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

name: Iron Defender
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.text: The defender has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.text: While the defender is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or take an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage and be grappled (escape DC 13). The defender can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

traits.name: All-Around Vision
traits.text: The quori can't be surprised while it isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The quori can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The quori has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The quori makes two Soul Binding attacks. Alternatively, it can make four attacks with Arcane Blast.

actions.name: Arcane Blast
actions.text: rs +13 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) force damage.

actions.name: Soul Binding
actions.text: ms +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and has its soul imprisoned in one of the quori's eyes. The target can't be revived by any means short of a wish spell until the quori is destroyed.

actions.name: Mind Seed (1/Day)
actions.text:
The quori touches one humanoid, which must succeed on a DC 21 Intelligence saving throw or be cursed. The curse lasts until it's removed by a remove curse or greater restoration spell.

The cursed target suffers 1 level of exhaustion every 24 hours, and finishing a long rest doesn't reduce its exhaustion. If the cursed target reaches exhaustion level 6, it doesn't die; it instead becomes a thrall under the quori's control, and all its exhaustion is removed. Only the wish spell can free the thrall from this control.

actions.name: Swarm of Eyes (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The quori creates a swarm of spectral eyes that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage, and it is blinded for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Possession (recharge on 6)
actions.text:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 21 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

traits.name: Dual Mind
traits.text: The kalashtar has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Mind Thrust
actions.text: The kalashtar targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The soldier has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the soldier's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the soldier to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the soldier drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The soldier attacks three times with one of its weapons.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Illmarrow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Illmarrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: Illmarrow's body turns to dust when she drops to 0 hit points, and her equipment is left behind. She gains a new body after 1d10 days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within two hundred miles of the location at which she was destroyed.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. On hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Illmarrow's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against Illmarrow until the end of her next turn.

actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Poison Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
Illmarrow exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't regain hit points. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.

A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises at the start of Illmarrow's next turn as a zombie. The zombie acts immediately after Illmarrow in the initiative count and is permanently under her command, following her verbal orders.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Lady Illmarrow can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Lady Illmarrow regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.text: Illmarrow casts a cantrip.

legendary_actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
legendary_actions.text: Illmarrow uses her Paralyzing Claw.

legendary_actions.name: Frightening Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Illmarrow targets up to three creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Illmarrow's Frightening Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Poison Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Illmarrow recharges her Poison Breath and uses it.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.text: ms +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The living spell unleashes a thin sheet of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.text: ms +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) poison damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
The living spell creates a 40-foot-diameter sphere of fog within 60 feet of it (the fog spreads around corners). When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fog moves 10 feet away from the living spell at the start of each of its turns, rolling along the ground and through openings. The fog lasts for 10 minutes or until the living spell's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.text: ms +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) lightning damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The living spell unleashes a stroke of lightning in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.text: Mordakhesh can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless he wishes to be. Mordakhesh has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Mordakhesh makes three greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Orb
actions.text: rs +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. On hit: 13 (3d8) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Mordakhesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Mordakhesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: Mordakhesh makes one weapon attack or casts chromatic orb.

legendary_actions.name: Chromatic Resistance
legendary_actions.text: Modakhesh gains resistance to one damage type of his choice—acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder—until the start of his next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Warlord's Command (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Mordakhesh targets up to two allies that he can see within 30 feet of him. If a target can see and hear him, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Aura of False Divinity
traits.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the radiant idol must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, provided the radiant idol isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the radiant idol. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, a creature is immune to this radiant idol's Aura of False Divinity for 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The radiant idol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The radiant idol makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Flail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Strike (1/Day)
actions.text: The radiant idol chooses a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet of it. A 30-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder of bright light appears there until the start of the radiant idol's next turn. Each creature in the cylinder when it appears or that ends its turn there must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Rak Tulkhesh
speed: walk 40 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.

traits.name: Deadly Critical
traits.text: Rak Tulkhesh scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 and rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Rak Tulkhesh fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Rak Tulkhesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Whirlwind of Weapons
traits.text: A magical aura of weapons surrounds Rak Tulkhesh in a 10 foot radius. At the start of each of his turns, any other creature in the aura takes 14 (4d6) force damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Rak Tulkhesh makes four weapon attacks.

actions.name: Spawned Melee Weapon
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage.

actions.name: Spawned Ranged Weapon
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +12 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
Rak Tulkhesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than his own, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (his choice).

In a new form, Rak Tulkhesh retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Rak Tulkhesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Rak Tulkhesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: Rak Tulkhesh makes one weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: End Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Rak Tulkhesh casts dispel magic.

legendary_actions.name: Provoke Rage (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Each creature within 60 feet of Rak Tulkhesh must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged weapon attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary. This attack is made with advantage and gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.

traits.name: Shifting (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.text: As a bonus action, the shifter takes on a more bestial form for 1 minute or until it dies. The shifter gains 5 temporary hit points. It can make a bite attack when it activates this trait and also as a bonus action on each of its turns while in its bestial form.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Sul Khatesh fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Sul Khatesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Magic
traits.text: Sul Khatesh has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Sul Khatesh makes four attacks with Arcane Blast.

actions.name: Arcane Blast
actions.text: rs +18 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Magic Staff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 36 (5d12 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.text: Sul Khatesh conjures orbs of magical energy that plummet to the ground at three different points she can see within 1 mile of her. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 (11d12) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one arcane burst is affected only once. The area of each arcane burst then acts as an antimagic field for 1 hour. Sul Khatesh and spells she casts are unaffected by these fields.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
Sul Khatesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. She reverts to her true form if she dies. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sul Khatesh's choice).

In a new form, Sul Khatesh retains her alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Sul Khatesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Sul Khatesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: Sul Khatesh makes two attacks with her Arcane Blast or one attack with her magic staff.

legendary_actions.name: Consume Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Sul Khatesh targets a creature within 120 feet of her who is concentrating on a spell. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or its concentration is broken on the spell, and Sul Khatesh gains 5 temporary hit points per level of that spell.

legendary_actions.name: Maddening Secrets (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Sul Khatesh whispers an arcane secret into the mind of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or expend one of its spell slots of 3rd level or lower and deal 26 (4d12) force damage to each creature within 30 feet of it. A creature that fails the saving throw but can't expend a spell slot is instead stunned until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unstable Mark
traits.text: When the assassin casts an innate spell, each creature within 10 feet of the assassin must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d10) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

actions.name: Chromatic Orb (1/Day)
actions.text: rs +4 to hit, range 90 ft., one creature. On hit: 18 (4d8) damage of a type chosen by the assassin: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

traits.name: Adamantine Plating
traits.text: Any critical hit against the Lord of Blades becomes a normal hit.

traits.name: Bladed Armor
traits.text: A creature that grapples the Lord of Blades or is grappled by him takes 13 (3d8) slashing damage. A creature takes 13 (3d8) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being grappled by the Lord of Blades.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the Lord of Blades moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with his adamantine sixblade on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Warforged Resilience
traits.text: The Lord of Blades has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, is immune to disease, and magic can't put him to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Lord of Blades makes three attacks: two with his adamantine sixblade and one with his bladed wings.

actions.name: Adamantine Sixblade
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

actions.name: Bladed Wings
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (4d10) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The The Lord of Blades can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The The Lord of Blades regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: The Lord of Blades makes one weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.text: The Lord of Blades casts one of his cantrips.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The Lord of Blades casts a spell of 2nd level or lower from his spell list that takes 1 action to cast.

legendary_actions.name: Blade Dash (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The Lord of Blades moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then makes one attack with his adamantine sixblade. He can make one bladed wings attack against each creature he moves past.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The quori makes three attacks: one pincer attack, one attack with its claws, and one stinger attack.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The quori has two pincers, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the quori for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Possession (recharge on 6)
actions.text:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

traits.name: Aura of Radiance
traits.text: The councilor magically sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The councilor can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action. If the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created that darkness is dispelled.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The councilor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The councilor makes two Radiant Touch attacks.

actions.name: Radiant Touch
actions.text: ms +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.text: The councilor touches another creature. The target magically regains 18 (3d8 + 5) hit points and is freed from one curse afflicting it (councilor's choice).

actions.name: Flame Strike (5th-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.text: The councilor chooses a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the councilor casts this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (its choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Undying Councilor can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Undying Councilor regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Touch
legendary_actions.text: The councilor makes one attack with its Radiant Touch.

legendary_actions.name: Shimmering Aura (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The councilor channels positive energy into its Aura of Radiance. Until the end of the councilor's next turn, it sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the councilor's next turn.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The soldier magically sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The soldier can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.text: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The soldier makes two spear attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

traits.name: Bonding
traits.text: The hawk can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hawk bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hawk and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Talons
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Bonding
traits.text: The hound can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hound bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hound and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.text: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Bonding
traits.text: The steed can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the steed bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the steed and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Towering Terror
traits.text: Any enemy outside the colossus that starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the enemy's next turn. If the enemy's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this colossus's Towering Terror for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The colossus makes three attacks—one with its slam and two with its eldritch turrets—and then uses Stomp.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the colossus can push the target up to 20 feet away from it.

actions.name: Eldritch Turret
actions.text: rs +18 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (4d8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.text:
The colossus stomps one of its feet at a point on the ground within 20 feet of it. Any creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature is restrained. While restrained in this way, the creature (or another creature within 5 feet of it) can use its action to make a DC 26 Strength check. On a success, the creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained.

Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

actions.name: Incinerating Beam (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The colossus fires a beam of light in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this beam is disintegrated, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Warforged Resilience
traits.text: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

actions.name: Armblade
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Warforged Titan
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Platforms
traits.text: The warforged titan has two platforms built into its chassis. One Medium or smaller creature can ride on each platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the warforged, they must use spears or weapons with reach and the target must be Large or larger.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The warforged titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The warforged titan makes one axehand attack and one hammerfist attack.

actions.name: Axehand
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage, plus 11 (2d10) slashing damage if the target is prone.

actions.name: Hammerfist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Sweeping Axe (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The warforged titan makes a sweep with its axehand, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.text: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The rakshasa's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Martial Prowess (1/Turn)
traits.text: When the rakshasa hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage of the weapon's type, and the creature must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to 10 feet away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa's choice.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The rakshasa makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Helpful
traits.text: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Tools
traits.text: The expert has thieves' tools and a musical instrument.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magical Role
traits.text: Choose a role for the spellcaster: healer or mage. Your choice determines which Spellcasting trait to use below.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

traits.name: Martial Role
traits.text:
The warrior has one of the following traits of your choice:

• Attacker The warrior gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls.
• Defender The warrior gains the Protection reaction below

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the anarch can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The anarch deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Spiked Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands.

traits.name: Eye of the Law
traits.text: As a bonus action, the archon can target a creature it can see within 120 feet of it and determine which laws that creature has broken in the last 24 hours.

traits.name: Mount
traits.text: If the archon isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the archon and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the archon appears astride the mount along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the archon can't be surprised, and both it and its mount gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws. If the archon is reduced to 0 hit points while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 hit points as well.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The archon makes two Hammer of Justice attacks.

actions.name: Hammer of Justice
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Pacifying Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the archon's choice that the archon can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, or else the target drops any weapons it is holding, ends its concentration on any spells or other effects, and becomes charmed by the archon for 1 minute. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the archon's Pacifying Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Archon of the Triumvirate can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Archon of the Triumvirate regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Rejoin Mount
legendary_actions.text: If the archon isn't mounted, it magically teleports to its steed and mounts it as long as the archon and its steed are on the same plane of existence.

legendary_actions.name: Smite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The archon makes a Hammer of Justice attack, and then its mount can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Detention (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The archon targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or be magically teleported to a harmless demiplane until the end of the archon's next turn, whereupon the target reappears in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The arclight phoenix doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Grounded Lightning
traits.text: The first time on a turn that the arclight phoenix touches the ground, it takes 11 (2d10) force damage.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The arclight phoenix sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

traits.name: Lightning Form
traits.text: The arclight phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage. In addition, the arclight phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

traits.name: Crackling Death
traits.text: When the arclight phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion destroys the phoenix but leaves behind a Tiny, warm egg with a mizzium shell. The egg contains the embryo of a new arclight phoenix. It hatches when it is in the area of a spell that deals lightning damage, or if a creature touches the egg and expends spell slots whose combined levels equal 13 or more. When it hatches, the egg releases a new arclight phoenix that appears in the egg's space.

actions.name: Arclight Touch
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 27 (6d8) lightning damage, and lightning jumps from the target to one creature of the phoenix's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target. That second creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Aurelia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Aurelia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Aurelia makes three longsword attacks and uses Leadership.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (1d8 + 8) slashing damage, or 13 (1d10 + 8) slashing damage when used with two hands, plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Leadership
actions.text: Aurelia utters a few inspiring words to one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the creature can hear her, it can add a d10 to one attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of Aurelia's next turn.

actions.name: Warleader's Helix (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: rs +17 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. On hit: 54 (12d8) radiant damage, and Aurelia can choose another creature she can see within 10 feet of the target. The second creature regains 27 (6d8) hit points.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Aurelia can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Aurelia regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Command Allies
legendary_actions.text: Aurelia chooses up to three creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. If a chosen creature can see or hear Aurelia, it can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, with advantage on the attack roll.

legendary_actions.name: Longsword Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Aurelia makes one longsword attack.

legendary_actions.name: Frighten Foes (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Aurelia targets up to five creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 25 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her until the end of her next turn. Any target within 5 feet of Aurelia has disadvantage on the saving throw.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The angel doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The angel makes two melee attacks. It also uses Battlefield Inspiration.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage. If the target is within 5 feet of any of the angel's allies, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Battlefield Inspiration
actions.text: The angel chooses up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Until the end of the angel's next turn, each target can add a d4 to its attack rolls and saving throws.

traits.name: Bolstering Presence
traits.text: The biomancer magically emanates life-giving energy within 30 feet of itself. Any ally of the biomancer that starts its turn there regains 5 (1d10) hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The biomancer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Feed on Fire
traits.text: If the weird takes fire damage from a spell or other magical effect, its size increases by one category. If there isn't enough room for the weird to increase in size, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available. While the weird is Large or bigger, it makes Strength checks and saving throws with advantage. If the weird starts its turn at Gargantuan size, the weird releases energy in an explosion. Each creature within 30 feet of the weird must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. The weird's size then becomes Medium.

traits.name: Form of Fire and Water
traits.text: The weird can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the weird can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the weird enters another creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.text: A creature that touches the weird or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The weird sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, or 11 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage if the weird is Large or bigger.

name: Blood Drinker Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite

On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be charmed by the vampire for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target is infatuated with the vampire. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Blood Witch

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the witch's darkvision.

actions.name: Multiattack

If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Borborygmos's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Borborygmos's Bellow for the next 24 hours.

The first time Borborygmos enters a creature's space during this move, the creature must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from Borborygmos. If the saving throw fails, that creature is knocked prone, and Borborygmos can make a stomp attack against it.

traits.text: The cackler can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 11 Wisdom (Insight) check.

A target restrained in this way can use an action to make a DC 17 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +8 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

The mount remains for 8 hours, until it or the dryad dies, or until the dryad dismisses it as an action. The mount uses the stat block of an elk (see the Monster Manual) with these changes: it is a plant instead of a beast, it has an Intelligence of 6, and it understands Sylvan but can't speak. While within 1 mile of the mount, the dryad can communicate with it telepathically.

actions.name: Suppress Magic (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The dryad targets one magic item it can see within 120 feet of it. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, until the dryad is incapacitated or dies, or until the dryad uses a bonus action to end the effect.

traits.name: Empowered Spell (3/Day)
traits.text: When the blastseeker rolls damage for a spell, it can reroll up to four dice of damage. It must use the new dice.

traits.name: Tides of Chaos (1/Day)
traits.text: The blastseeker makes one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

traits.name: Counterflux Overcast (recharge 5-6)

The blastseeker creates a 15-foot-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. 4-6. The blastseeker creates a 15-foot-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.text: As a bonus action, the angel targets a creature charmed by it that it can see within 30 feet of it. The angel deals 11 (2d10) necrotic damage to the target, and the angel gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)

traits.text: The lich regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the lich takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the lich's next turn. The lich dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.text: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the lich to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the lich drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Bonding
traits.text: The felidar can magically bond with one creature it can see, right after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the felidar bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. This bond has the following effects: The felidar and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet. The felidar can sense the direction and distance to the bonded creature if they're on the same plane of existence. As an action, the felidar or the bonded creature can sense what the other sees and hears, during which time it loses its own sight and hearing. This effect lasts until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: The felidar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.
