traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.text: Spellix has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
actions.text: ms +5 to hit (with advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.text: The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.text: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of the whale's turns. If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage, or 37 (6d6 + 16) bludgeoning damage if the target is an object.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 16). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The mimic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The mimic attacks three times: twice with its pseudopods and once with its bite.

actions.name: Pseudopods
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Spit Acid (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The mimic spits acid at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 32 (9d6 + 1) acid damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Telepathic Pentacle
speed: walk 30 ft., swim 30 ft., climb 30 ft.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The Telepathic Pentacle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.text:
The Telepathic Pentacle has five heads. While it has more than one head, the Telepathic Pentacle has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

Whenever the Telepathic Pentacle takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the Telepathic Pentacle dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The Telepathic Pentacle regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.text: For each head the Telepathic Pentacle has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: While the Telepathic Pentacle sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Telepathic Pentacle makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

name: Tomb Tapper
languages: understands Common and Undercommon but doesn't speak

traits.name: Petrified Death
traits.text: A tomb tapper reduced to 0 hit points turns into a lifeless stone statue. Anything it's wearing or carrying is not transformed.

traits.name: Sense Magic
traits.text: The tomb tapper senses magic within 30 feet of it and can use an action to pinpoint the location of any creature, object, or area in that range that bears magic. This sense penetrates barriers but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The tomb tapper can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The tomb tapper doesn't require air or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The tomb tapper makes two melee attacks with its sledgehammer or with its claws. If it hits the same creature with both claws, it can pull that creature within 5 feet of its mouth and make a bite attack against it.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sledgehammer
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) bludgeoning or force damage (tomb tapper's choice). If thrown, the hammer returns to the tomb tapper at the end of its turn, landing at the tomb tapper's feet if it doesn't have a hand free to catch the weapon.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Vellynne wears bracers of defense and carries a wand of magic missiles (see "Actions" below).

actions.name: Vampiric Touch (3rd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.text: ms +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and Vellynne regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. If Vellynne casts this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. On hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Vellynne's next turn.

actions.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
actions.text: While holding this wand, Vellynne can expend 1 or more of its 7 charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. She can expend 1 charge to cast the 1st-level version of the spell. She can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge she expends. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If the wand's last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

traits.name: Simple Weapon Wielder
traits.text: A simple weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the verbeeg hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The verbeeg makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage if used to make a ranged attack or used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Sling
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (3d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Simple Weapon Wielder
traits.text: A simple weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the verbeeg hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The verbeeg makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage if used to make a ranged attack or used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The walrus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

actions.name: Tusks
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.text: Xardorok has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, Xardorok has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Xardorok attacks twice with a weapon or casts eldritch blast twice.

actions.name: Spiked Gauntlet
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, or 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage while Xardorok is enlarged.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
actions.text: rs +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. On hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: For 1 minute, Xardorok magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Xardorok is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in his attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Xardorok lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Invisibility (recharge 4-6)
actions.text: Xardorok magically turns invisible until he attacks, he casts a spell, he uses his Enlarge, or his concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Xardorok wears or carries is invisible with him.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 slashing damage.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The ettin's right head exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Cold Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The ettin's left head exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Gaze
actions.text:
The ettin turns its magical gaze toward one creature that it can see within 120 feet of it. That target must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the target is incapacitated, it can avert its eyes to avoid the gaze and to automatically succeed on the save. If the target does so, it can't see the ettin until the start of the ettin's next turn. If the target looks at the ettin in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the target fails the save, it suffers one of the following effects of the ettin's choice or at random:

actions.name: Beguiling Gaze
actions.text: The target is stunned until the start of the ettin's next turn or until the ettin is no longer within line of sight.

actions.name: Hypnotic Gaze
actions.text: The target is charmed by the ettin until the start of the ettin's next turn. The ettin chooses how the charmed target uses its actions, reactions, and movement.

actions.name: Insanity Gaze
actions.text: The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of the ettin's next turn. The ettin doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.

traits.name: Rust Monster Cloak
traits.text: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits Barbatos corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits Barbatos is destroyed after dealing damage.

traits.name: Heart of the Troll
traits.text: Barbatos regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If Barbatos takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of Barbatos's next turn. Barbatos dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Barbatos makes two bone shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Bone Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

actions.name: Cloak Sweep
actions.text:
Barbatos corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object he can see within 5 feet of himself. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw to avoid Barbatos's touch.

If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in Barbatos's Rust Monster Cloak trait.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Lynx's crystal eye is a magically shrunken crystal ball of true seeing. One of her teeth is a refashioned ring of mind shielding, while another has been magicked to place her under a permanent Nystul's magic aura spell, concealing the magic of these items and hiding her true nature from magic or features that can detect undead.

traits.name: Aversion of Fire
traits.text: If Lynx takes fire damage, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of her next turn.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: Lynx is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.text: Whenever Lynx is subjected to lightning damage, she takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Lynx has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Lynx regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Lynx's body is destroyed only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: Lynx is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Lynx makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Moghadam wields Ruinblade (see appendix C).

traits.name: Artificial Mind
traits.text: Moghadam can manifest an artificial mind as a floating spectral image of a demilich's jeweled skull. Moghadam can communicate telepathically with this mind, send it up to 300 feet away from him, and see and hear through it.

traits.name: Infoportation (1/Day)
traits.text: Moghadam can teleport himself into an unoccupied space next to his artificial mind.

actions.name: Ruinblade
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blight (1/Day)
actions.text: While wielding  Ruinblade, Moghadam can cast the blight spell (DC 15).

actions.name: Disintegrate (1/7 Days)
actions.text: While wielding Ruinblade, Moghadam can cast the disintegrate spell against any nonmagical object or creation of magical force.

actions.name: Information Overload (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Moghadam overloads the thoughts of one creature within 5 feet of either himself or his artificial mind. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of Moghadam's next turn has advantage.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.text: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The neo-otyugh makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and restrained until the grapple ends. The neo-otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.text: The neo-otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the neo-otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Sir Ursas wears a ring of mind shielding and plate armor of fire resistance.

traits.name: Brave
traits.text: Sir Ursas has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Brute
traits.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Sir Ursas hits with it (included in his attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Sir Ursas makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Thessalar wields a +1 dagger coated with thessaltoxin poison (see appendix C).

traits.name: Alchemical Homunculus
traits.text: Thessalar is accompanied by his thessalars homunculus. If the mending spell is cast on it, the homunculus regains 2d6 hit points.

traits.name: Healing Toxicity
traits.text: Any magic item that restores hit points and can be applied to a piercing or slashing weapon (a potion, an ointment, and so forth) causes a hit with that weapon to deal extra damage to Thessalar equal to the amount the item would normally heal.

traits.name: Greater Restoration (1/Day)
traits.text: Thessalar can cast greater restoration if he has access to alchemical supplies.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is affected as if by the polymorph spell, transforming into a random beast or a creature it has seen within the last 24 hours (as chosen by the DM). This effect lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

name: Thessalheart Construct
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.text: While the construct is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The thessalkraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Freedom of Movement
traits.text: The thessalkraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The thessalkraken makes one bite attack and two tentacle attacks. It can replace each tentacle attack with one use of Fling.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) acid damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the thessalkraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the thessalkraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the thessalkraken's turns.

If the thessalkraken takes 35 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the thessalkraken. If the thessalkraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The thessalkraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Fling
actions.text: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the thessalkraken is thrown up to 40 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Acid Saliva (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The thessalkraken spits a glob of acid at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Thessalkraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Thessalkraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle Attack
legendary_actions.text: The thessalkraken makes one tentacle attack.

legendary_actions.name: Fling
legendary_actions.text: The thessalkraken uses Fling.

legendary_actions.name: Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: While underwater, the thessalkraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the thessalkraken. Each creature other than the thessalkraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the thessalkraken's next turn.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The two-headed crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The two-headed crocodile has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: When one of the crocodile's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The two-headed crocodile makes two attacks with its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and that head of the crocodile can't bite another target.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The two-headed owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: When one of the owlbear's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The two-headed owlbear makes three attacks: two with its beaks and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.text: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.text: Krenko can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Krenko makes two attacks with his scimitar.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage..

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.text: The rig is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rig must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Unstable
traits.text: If the rig takes damage, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated with a speed of 0 until a creature activates it with a successful DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) check made as an action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The armor makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Detect Sentience
traits.text: The brain in a jar can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The brain in a jar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Mind Blast (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The brain in a jar magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 13 (2d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Clockwork Kraken
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The clockwork kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Independent Tentacles
traits.text:
The clockwork kraken has eight tentacles, each of which is treated as a Medium creature, moves independently on the construct's turn, and has a flying speed of 40 feet. The clockwork kraken's senses operate through its tentacles as well as its main body. Each tentacle can be attacked independently, with damage dealt to tentacles applied to the clockwork kraken's hit point total. A tentacle is destroyed if it takes more than 20 damage.

Reducing the construct to three or fewer tentacles reduces its attacks accordingly. A clockwork kraken can regrow any destroyed tentacles at the end of a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The clockwork kraken makes four tentacle slam attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Garret wears a Ring of Warmth (included in his statistics) and wields a Gambler's Blade longsword.

traits.name: Bardic Inspiration (3/Day)
traits.text: As a bonus action, Garret can give one chosen creature (other than him) a d6 inspiration die. The chosen creature must be within 60 feet of Garret and able to hear him. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can use the inspiration die after the roll is made but before the DM says whether it succeeds or fails. Once the inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one inspiration die at a time.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.text: On each of his turns, Garret can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.text: Garret deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Garret that isn't incapacitated and Garret doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Mary wears Bracers of Defense and a Ring of Protection, and carries a Deck of Several Things

traits.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short Rest)
traits.text: Mary can cause each creature within 10 feet of her to succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed or frightened by her (Mary's choice) until the end of her next turn.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: Mary has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.text: Even when an ooze-folk is in plain sight, it takes a DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot an ooze-folk that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the ooze-folk's space while unaware of the ooze-folk is surprised by the ooze-folk.

traits.name: Fragile Bones
traits.text: For each 5 damage it takes, the ooze-folk's walking speed is reduced by 5 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ooze folk makes one glass longsword attack and one pseudopod attack.

actions.name: Glass Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage. If a 1 is rolled on an attack roll with a glass longsword, it shatters and can no longer be used.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) acid damage.

name: Ash Zombie
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Ash Puff
traits.text: The first time the zombie takes damage, any living creature within 5 feet of the zombie must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on it early with a successful save.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The wraith can move through an object or another creature, but can't stop there.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. If this attack reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Nezznar has a spider staff.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: Nezznar has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: Nezznar has disadvantage on attack rolls when he or his target is in sunlight.

actions.name: Spider Staff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ruffian makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Sildar makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow
traits.text:
At the start of a short or long rest, Amble can touch a point in space, and an invisible, 30-foot-radius sphere of magic appears, centered on that point. Total cover blocks the sphere.

While within the sphere, Amble and their allies gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) and Wisdom (Perception) checks, and any light from open flames in the sphere isn't visible outside it.

The sphere vanishes at the end of the rest or when Amble leaves the sphere.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: Amble can hold their breath for up to 1 hour at a time.

traits.name: Balm of the Summer Court (12d6)
traits.text: (As a Bonus Action) Amble can choose one creature they can see within 120 feet of them and spend up to 6d6 of their die pool. Roll the spent dice and add them together. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the total. The target also gains 1 temporary hit point per die spent. Amble regains all expended dice when they finish a long rest.

traits.name: Hidden Paths (4/Day)
traits.text: (As a Bonus Action) Amble may teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

actions.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
actions.text:
Amble magically polymorphs into a beast with a challenge rating of 1 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 6 hours. Amble's equipment melds with their new form. Amble reverts to their true form if they die or fall unconscious. Amble can revert to their true form using a bonus action on their turn.

Amble's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but they retain their alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Amble also retains all their skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as Amble and the bonus in its stat block is higher, use the creature's bonus instead of Amble's.

When Amble transforms, they assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When Amble reverts to their normal form, they return to the number of hit points they had before they transformed. However, if Amble reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over their normal form.

Amble can't cast spells, and their ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of their beast form. Transforming doesn't break Amble's concentration on a spell they've already cast however, or prevent them from taking actions that are part of a spell.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit (+8 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: Gar can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Gar fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Water Walk
traits.text: Gar can stand and move on liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground.

traits.name: Watery Fall
traits.text: When Gar drops to 0 hit points, his body collapses into a pool of inky water that rapidly disperses. Except for Wave and his claw, anything he was wearing or carrying is left behind.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Gar makes two melee attacks, one with his claw and one with Wave.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, Gar can't attack other creatures with his claw.

actions.name: Wave
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage or 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage when used with two hands. If Gar scores a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes extra necrotic damage equal to half its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Umberlee's Wake (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Power ripples out in a 60-foot radius sphere from a point within range (150 ft.) as the will of Umberlee affects all in her watery embrace. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save. This only affects targets that are submerged or floating in water. Gar Shatterkeel and any undead serving him are immune to this effect.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Gar Shatterkeel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Gar Shatterkeel regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.text: Gar moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.text: Gar makes one attack with his claw.

legendary_actions.name: Wave (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Gar makes one attack with Wave with advantage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: Shoalar can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The kraken makes two tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage.

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. One Medium or two smaller creatures can be swallowed at the same time.

If the kraken takes 35 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in spaces within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Fling
actions.text: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 40 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Lightning Strike
actions.text: The kraken magically create a bolt of lightning, which can strike a target the kraken can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider shark can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the spider shark knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider shark ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The spider shark can make a hooked claw attack, a burrowing tooth attack, and a barbed web attack.

actions.name: Burrowing Tooth
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) damage, and the target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, or take an additional 4 (1d8) damage at the beginning of its turn each round. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Hooked Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, range 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) damage, and the target must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw, or be grappled and pulled towards the spider shark. While the target is grappled, attacks against it have advantage.

actions.name: Barbed Web Attack
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, range 90/90 ft., one creature. On hit: 18 (3d10 + 2) damage, and the target is retrained. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 18 Strength check, destroying from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 15; 25 hit points; is vulnerable to fire damage; and is immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

actions.name: Web Net (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The spider shark launches webs at a 30-foot radius area within 90 feet. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity save. On a failed save, the creature takes 18 (3d10 + 2) damage and is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 18 Strength check, destroying from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 15; 25 hit points; is vulnerable to fire damage; and is immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The assassin bug has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The assassin bug makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Ovipositor
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: The target is infested with 1d3 assassin bug eggs, which immediately hatch into assassin bug maggots. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage per maggot infesting it. Applying fire to the bite wound before the end of the target's next turn deals 1 fire damage to the target and kills these assassin bug maggots. After this time, the maggots are too far under the skin to be burned.

If a target infested by assassin bug maggots ends its turn with 0 hit points, it dies as the maggots burrow into its heart and kill it. Any effect that cures disease kills all assassin bug maggots infesting the target.

traits.name: Radiant Eyes
traits.text: While its eyes are open, a blindheim projects bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. It sets the orientation of this cone at the end of each of its turns. All creatures that can see the blindheim have disadvantage on attack rolls while in the area of bright light and within 15 feet of the blindheim. Creatures with the Sunlight Sensitivity trait that can see the blindheim have disadvantage on attack rolls anywhere in the area of bright light.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Radiant Blast
actions.text: Radiant energy erupts from the blindheim's eyes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) radiant damage and be blinded until the end of the blindheim's next turn. Creatures with the Sunlight Sensitivity trait have disadvantage on this saving throw.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.text: The crab folk can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged once every 24 hours to avoid suffocating.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The crab folk makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the crab folk can automatically hit the target with its claw, and the crab folk can't make attacks with that claw against other targets. The crab folk has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

traits.name: Dire Cacophony
traits.text: Any creature other than a dire corby that starts its turn within 60 feet of a dire corby and can hear it must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is unable to use the Dash action, cannot climb, or cast spells other than cantrips until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.text: The dire corby has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dire corby makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

name: Eye of Fear and Flame
languages: all languages known by any creature within 30 feet of it

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: The eye of fear and flame is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The eye of fear and flame makes two claw attacks and uses its Gemstone Eyes.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gemstone Eyes
actions.text:
The eye of fear and flame shoots one of the following magical eye rays, choosing one target it can see within 90 feet of it.

• Eye of Fear The target and up to four other creatures of the eye of fear and flame's choice within 10 feet of the target must each succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• Eye of Flame The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 44 (8d10) fire damage, and if it is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and does not ignite. A target that ignites takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns until a creature takes an action to douse the fire

traits.name: Denizen of the Mist
traits.text: During its turn, the fog giant ignores the effects of fog cloud spells cast by it or other allied fog giants.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The giant makes two greatsword attacks and casts fog cloud.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 29 (6d6 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Petty Tyrant (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The fog giant shouts bloodcurdling threats at the creatures that serve it. Each medium or smaller ally of the giant within 120 feet of it that can see or hear it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The forlarren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The forlarren makes two claw attacks and one gore attack, or it makes three chromatic ray attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Ray
actions.text: rs +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) lightning damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

traits.name: Lurkers in Shadow
traits.text: Jermlaine are invisible to darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The jermlaine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Vermin Friend
traits.text: The jermlaine can speak to and understand rats and giant rats.

traits.name: Swarming Rush
traits.text: A jermlaine adds 1d4 to its weapon damage rolls while within 5 feet of another, conscious jermlaine.

actions.name: Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack -1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 (1d4 - 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Iron Scent
traits.text: The khargra can scent the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and if the target is wearing metal armor or carrying a metal shield, the khargra attaches to that armor or shield. While attached, the khargra doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the khargra's turns, roll a d20. On a 10 or higher, the armor or shield takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

The khargra can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the khargra.

actions.name: Earth Phasing
actions.text: Until the end of its next turn, the khargra can fly through nonmagical earth and stone. While doing so, it doesn't disturb the material it moves through. It can end its movement within earth or stone, but if it remains within earth or stone when this ability ends, it takes 14 (4d6) force damage and immediately moves to the nearest unoccupied space.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack -1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Blessing of Bountiful Generosity (1/Day)
actions.text: The killmoulis targets up to eight creatures within 100 feet of it that it can see. The next time a target finishes a long rest, it regains all spent Hit Dice and gains 10 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Curse of Poor Hospitality (1/Day)
actions.text: The killmoulis targets up to eight creatures within 100 feet of it that it can see. The next time a target completes a long rest, it does not regain spent Hit Dice.

name: Mite
speed: walk 30 ft., burrow 10 ft., climb 30 ft.

traits.name: Vexing Presence
traits.text: While within 30 feet of a mite that can see it, a non-fey creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Blood Boiling Hex (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The mite places a hex on a creature it can see within 60 feet of it for 1 minute. If the mite is hidden, using this ability does not reveal its location. While the creature is affected by this hex, whenever it makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it must roll a d6 and subtract the number rolled from the d20 roll. On any turn in which it suffers the effect of the hex, the target can attack an ally as a reaction, ignoring the effect of the hex when it does so. It can then ignore the effect of the hex until the end of its turn.

traits.name: Needle Defense
traits.text: Each time a creature makes a melee attack against a needle lord, it takes 2 piercing damage. A creature can choose to make an attack with disadvantage to avoid this damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The nettle lord makes 2 raking vine attacks.

actions.name: Needle Volley
actions.text: The needle lord makes up to 1d6 needle attacks, but it cannot attack the same target more than twice during its turn.

actions.name: Raking Vine
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 11 piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The needle lord has two raking vines, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Needle
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +2 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Close Quarters Shooting
traits.text: The needle spawn does not suffer disadvantage on ranged attacks while within 5 feet of a hostile creature that can see it and isn't incapacitated, if the target of the attack is also within 5 feet of the needle spawn.

actions.name: Needle Volley
actions.text: The needle spawn makes up to 1d6 needle attacks, but it cannot attack the same target more than twice during its turn.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Needle
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The norker makes one mace and one bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Mace
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The norker war leader makes one greataxe and one bite attack, and also uses Fight On, You Slugs.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fight On, You Slugs
actions.text: The norker war leader picks up to three allied goblinoids within 60 feet that can see it. The chosen creatures can each use their reactions to make a single melee attack.

traits.name: Agile Flier
traits.text: Opportunity attacks against the screaming devilkin have disadvantage while it is flying.

traits.name: Ceaseless Screaming
traits.text:
Any creature other than a screaming devilkin that starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more screaming devilkins and can hear it must make a DC 10

Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the creature is incapacitated until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature suffers no effect.

traits.name: Stunted Legs
traits.text: The screaming devilkin has disadvantage on attack rolls and all attack rolls made against it gain advantage while the devilkin isn't flying.

actions.name: Barbed Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Ethereal Jaunt
traits.text: As a bonus action, a xill can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

traits.name: Poison Stinger
traits.text: The xill injects poison into one creature it hit with its claws this turn. The chosen creature must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, with disadvantage if the xill hit it more than once this turn, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned this way.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The xill makes four claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Ygorl, Lord of Entropy
speed: walk 40 ft., climb 40 ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Entropic Aura
traits.text: Each creature that is not a construct or undead that ends its turn within 15 feet of Ygorl takes 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Ygorl fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Ygorl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Ygorl makes three attacks: two with its scythe, and one with its Entropic Touch.

actions.name: Scythe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) slashing damage plus 19 (3d12) necrotic damage. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points by this attack dies, with its body and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, exploding into a cloud of ash. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a wish spell.

actions.name: Entropic Touch
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

actions.name: Summon Slaadi (1/Day)
actions.text: Ygorl summons 1d4 + 1 death slaadi. A summoned slaad appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Ygorl, acts as an ally of Ygorl, and can't summon other slaadi. It remains for 1 minute, until it or Ygorl dies, or until Ygorl dismisses it as an action.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: Ygorl teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Ygorl, Lord of Entropy can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Ygorl, Lord of Entropy regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Scythe
legendary_actions.text: Ygorl makes one attack with its scythe.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.text: Ygorl uses its Teleport action.

legendary_actions.name: Call the Void (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Each creature that is not a construct or undead within 30 feet of Ygorl must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw against the lord of entropy's attempt to unmake life, taking 42 (12d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Ygorl then regains a number of hit points equal to half the total damage taken by all affected creatures.

traits.name: Dive Attack
traits.text: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage to the target.

actions.name: Talon
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Summon Air Elemental
actions.text: Five aarakocra within 30 feet of each other can magically summon an air elemental. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain concentration while doing so (as if concentrating on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within 5 feet of it can return with it.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.text: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.text: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Enslave (3/Day)
actions.text:
The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Aboleth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Aboleth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.text: The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Swipe
legendary_actions.text: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: One creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.text: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.text: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 (6d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

actions.name: Cold Breath (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The yeti exhales a 30-foot cone of frigid air. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

name: Adult Black Dragon
speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Acid Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The dragon exhales acid in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Adult Black Dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Adult Black Dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Adult Blue Dracolich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Adult Blue Dracolich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.text: The dracolich makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The dracolich beats its tattered wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dracolich must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. After beating its wings this way, the dracolich can fly up to half its flying speed.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

name: Adult Green Dragon
speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Poison Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Breath Weapons (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

• Cold Breath. The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking 58 (13d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
• Paralyzing Breath. The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
