traits.name: Air Form
traits.text: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind (recharge 4-6)
actions.text:
Each creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the allosaurus moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the allosaurus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Ancient Gold Dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Ancient Gold Dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

name: Ancient Green Dragon
speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Poison Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 77 (22d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.text: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Roar (3/Day)
actions.text:
The sphinx emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. Each creature within 500 feet of the sphinx and able to hear the roar must make a saving throw.

• First Roar Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• Second Roar Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• Third Roar Each creature makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Androsphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Androsphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Claw Attack
legendary_actions.text: The sphinx makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The sphinx casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.text: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The armor makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can bite only the grappled creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

actions.name: Acid Spray (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, provided that it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ape makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The arcanaloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The arcanaloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The arcanaloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

name: Assassin
languages: Thieves' cant plus any two languages

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.text: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.text: The assassin deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Awakened Shrub

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the shrub remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal shrub.

actions.name: Rake
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.text: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, it deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The baboon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor's weapons.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.text: At the start of each of the balor's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The balor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The balor's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The balor makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its whip.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the balor scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Whip
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 25 feet toward the balor.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The balor magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Detect Life
traits.text: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

actions.name: Corrupting Touch
actions.text: ms +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage
actions.text: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Wail (1/Day)
actions.text: The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Barbed Hide
traits.text: At the start of each of its turns, the barbed devil deals 5 (1d10) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The devil makes three melee attacks: one with its tail and two with its claws. Alternatively, it can use Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.text: rs +5 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the barlgura can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Running Leap
traits.text: The barlgura's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet when it has a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The barlgura makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its fists.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.text:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.text: The bat can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.text: The bat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 1 piercing damage.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Steadfast
traits.text: The devil can't be frightened while it can see an allied creature within 30 feet of it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The devil makes two attacks: one with its beard and one with its glaive.

actions.name: Beard
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or lose 5 (1d10) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. On hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.text: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

• 1. Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.
• 2. Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
• 6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is incapacitated.
	If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.
• 7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.
• 8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.
• 9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.
	If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
• 10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The beholder can take 3 legendary actions, using the Eye Ray option below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The beholder regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.text: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

	If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger nonmagical object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it

If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target instantly transforms into a red slaad or, if it has the ability to cast spells of 3rd level or higher, a green slaad. actions.name: Animate Chains (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text:
Up to four chains the devil can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor-edged barbs and animate under the devil's control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried.

Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the devil uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the devil is incapacitated or dies.

traits.name: Drone
traits.text: The chasme produces a horrid droning sound to which demons are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn with in 30 feet of the chasme must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. A creature that can't hear the drone automatically succeeds on the save. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to splash it with holy water. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the drone for the next 24 hours.

traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

actions.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: Haste (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.text: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down). and that creature takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.text: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The cloaker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target's head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Moan
actions.text: Each creature within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of the cloaker's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker's moan for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Phantasms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text:
The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.

Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight.

A duplicate has the cloaker's AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

actions.name: Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

name: Copper Dragon Wyrmling
speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapons (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

• Acid Breath. The dragon exhales acid in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
• Slowing Breath. The dragon exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Shielded Mind
traits.text: The couatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice).

In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The crab can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: The claw is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning or slashing damage (claw's choice).

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.text: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.text: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.text: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The cyclops makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

name: Dao
speed: walk 30 ft., burrow 30 ft., fly 30 ft.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.text: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.text: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Maul
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength check or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.text: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

actions.name: Crush
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.

While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.

A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful DC 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
actions.text: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

traits.name: Two-Headed
traits.text: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dog makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Marshal Undead
traits.text: Unless the death knight is incapacitated, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The death knight makes three longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
actions.text: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or greatsword.

actions.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Negative Energy Cone
traits.text:
The death tyrant's central eye emits an invisible, magical 150-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, the tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a zombie under the tyrant's command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The death tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

• 1. Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the death tyrant for 1 hour, or until the death tyrant harms the creature.
• 2. Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
• 6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or the death tyrant moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant is incapacitated.
	If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.
• 7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.
• 8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.
• 9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.
	If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
• 10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Death Tyrant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Death Tyrant regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.text: The death tyrant uses one random eye ray.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.text: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.text: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Poisoned Dart
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.text: If the demilich is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: The demilich is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Howl (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The demilich emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the demilich that can hear the howl must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.text: The demilich targets up to three creatures that it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, and the demilich regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Demilich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Demilich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Flight
legendary_actions.text: The demilich flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Cloud of Dust
legendary_actions.text: The demilich magically swirls its dusty remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the demilich, including around a corner, must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the demilich's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the demilich's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Each creature with in 30 feet of the demilich must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 (3d6). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the  greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary_actions.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The demilich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The deva makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Mace
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.text: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text:
The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).

In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.text: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.text: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.text: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.text: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

actions.name: Create Whirlwind
actions.text:
A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.

A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.text: In the first round of a combat, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.text: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Read Thoughts
actions.text: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dragon turtle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

actions.name: Steam Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

name: Dretch
languages: telepathy 60 ft. (works only with creatures that understand Abyssal)

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The dretch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (2d4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fetid Cloud (1/Day)
actions.text: A 10-foot radius of disgusting green gas extends out from the dretch. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The drider makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Staff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.text: The drow magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a 50% chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The drow makes two scourge attacks.

actions.name: Scourge
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.text: The drow attempts to magically summon a yochlol with a 30%) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh or if wielded with two hands.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.text: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.text: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

actions.name: Club
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

actions.name: Fey Charm
actions.text:
The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.

The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The duodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.text: If the duodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The duodrone makes two fist attacks or two javelin attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.text: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blinding Breath (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Talons
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.text: If the efreeti dies, its body disintegrates in a flash of fire and puff of smoke, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.text: rs +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (5d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.text: If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. On hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. On hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

name: Empyrean
speed: walk 50 ft., fly 50 ft., swim 50 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the empyrean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The empyrean has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The empyrean's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Maul
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 31 (6d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

actions.name: Bolt
actions.text: rs +15 to hit, range 600 ft., one target. On hit: 24 (7d6) damage of one of the following types (empyrean's choice): acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, radiant, or thunder.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Empyrean can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Empyrean regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: The empyrean makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Bolster
legendary_actions.text: The empyrean bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can't be charmed or frightened, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Trembling Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The empyrean strikes the ground with its maul, triggering an earth tremor. All other creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the empyrean must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Hellish Weapons
traits.text: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 (3d8) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The erinyes makes three attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Web (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. On hit: The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 11 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to bludgeoning, poison and psychic damage.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.text:
A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature.

Red—5 years or less

Orange—6–10 years

Yellow—11–20 years

Green—21–30 years

Blue—31–40 years

Indigo—41–50 years

Violet—51 years or more

A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.text: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.text: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:

1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.

5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
