actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. On hit: The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.text: If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The monodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.text: If the monodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

name: Mud Mephit
speed: walk 20 ft., fly 20 ft., swim 20 ft.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.text: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of sticky mud. Each Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained until the end of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of mud.

actions.name: Fists
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Mud Breath (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The mephit belches viscid mud onto one creature within 5 feet of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.text: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.text: The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

name: Mummy
languages: the languages it knew in life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.text: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

name: Mummy Lord
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.text: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Mummy Lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Mummy Lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: The mummy lord makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.

legendary_actions.name: Blinding Dust
legendary_actions.text: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the mummy lord. Each creature within 5 feet of the mummy lord must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remain in its possession.

traits.name: Distress Spores
traits.text: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

traits.name: Sun Sickness
traits.text: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Day)
actions.text: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Rapport Spores
actions.text: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

traits.name: Distress Spores
traits.text: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

traits.name: Sun Sickness
traits.text: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The myconid uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Pacifying Spores, then makes a fist attack.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Animating Spores (3/Day)
actions.text: The myconid targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

actions.name: Hallucination Spores
actions.text: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Pacifying Spores
actions.text: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Rapport Spores
actions.text: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

traits.name: Distress Spores
traits.text: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

traits.name: Sun Sickness
traits.text: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Rapport Spores (3/Day)
actions.text: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Horror Nimbus (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee's Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Needles
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Night Hag Items
traits.text:
A night hag carries two very rare magic items that she must craft for herself. If either object is lost, the night hag will go to great lengths to retrieve it, as creating a new tool takes time and effort.

Heartstone: This lustrous black gem allows a night hag to become ethereal while it is in her possession. The touch of a heartstone also cures any disease. Crafting a heartstone takes 30 days.

Soul Bag: When an evil humanoid dies as a result of a night hag's Nightmare Haunting, the hag catches the soul in this black sack made of stitched flesh. A soul bag can hold only one evil soul at a time, and only the night hag who crafted the bag can catch a soul with it. Crafting a soul bag takes 7 days and a humanoid sacrifice (whose flesh is used to make the bag).

traits.name: Hag Coven
traits.text:
When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.

A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.

traits.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
traits.text:
A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes 3d10 psychic damage and is blinded for 24 hours.

A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

actions.name: Claws (Hag Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.text: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.

actions.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
actions.text: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the  greater restoration spell or similar magic.

name: Nightmare
languages: understands Abyssal, Common, and Infernal but can't speak

traits.name: Confer Fire Resistance
traits.text: The nightmare can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Ethereal Stride
actions.text: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.text: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The nothic makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rotting Gaze
actions.text: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Weird Insight
actions.text: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The nycaloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The nycaloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The nycaloth makes two melee attacks, or it makes one melee attack and teleports before or after the attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns due to a fiendish wound. Each time the nycaloth hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (2d4). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 13 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The nycaloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage
traits.text: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 10). Until this grapple ends, the octopus can't use its tentacles on another target.

actions.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: A 5-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Ogre Zombie
languages: understands Common and Giant but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage in Small or Medium form.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Gruumsh's Fury
traits.text: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (1d6 + 3 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Gruumsh's Fury
traits.text: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The orc makes two attacks with its greataxe or its spear.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (1d12 + 4 plus 1d8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (1d6 + 4 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
actions.text: Each creature of the war chief's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the war chief's next turn. The war chief can then make one attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.text: As a bonus action, the orog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The orog makes two greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.text: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The otyugh makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13) and restrained until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.text: The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: The owl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Talons

traits.text: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Beak
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell

actions.name: Telekinetic Thrust
actions.text:
The poltergeist targets a creature or unattended object within 30 feet of it. A creature must be Medium or smaller to be affected by this magic, and an object can weigh up to 150 pounds.

If the target is a creature, the poltergeist makes a Charisma check contested by the target's Strength check. If the poltergeist wins the contest, the poltergeist hurls the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target then comes into contact with a hard surface or heavy object, the target takes 1d6 damage per 10 feet moved.

If the target is an object that isn't being worn or carried, the poltergeist hurls it up to 30 feet in any direction. The poltergeist can use the object as a ranged weapon, attacking one creature along the object's path (+4 to hit) and dealing 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage on a hit.

A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.text: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a disease—a minuscule slaad egg.

A humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg to term at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.

If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the unborn slaad is disintegrated.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The shark has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.text: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.

If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet oft he remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

name: Revenant
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.text: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape DC 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.text: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the revenant for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

traits.text: If the rhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.text: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Reel
actions.text: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.text: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.text: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance

actions.name: Smother
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. On hit: The creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Iron Scent
traits.text: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

traits.name: Rust Metal
traits.text: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Non magical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.text:
The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch.

If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.text: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.text: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.text: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.text: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.text: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.text: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

actions.name: Spear
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Ram
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Scarecrow
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The scarecrow makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Glare
actions.text: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The frightened target is paralyzed.

actions.name: Sting
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.text:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

traits.name: Hag Coven
traits.text:
When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.

A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.

traits.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
traits.text:
A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes 3d10 psychic damage and is blinded for 24 hours.

A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.text: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.text:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The sea horse can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.text: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.text: While in bright light, the demon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.text: While in dim light or darkness, the demon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage or, if the demon had advantage on the attack roll, 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.text: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

name: Shield Guardian
languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.text: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The shield guardian regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.text: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

actions.name: Shriek
actions.text: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the shrieker, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for 1d4 of the shrieker's turns afterward.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapons (recharge 5-6)
actions.text:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

• Cold Breath. The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
• Paralyzing Breath. The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

name: Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.text: When the mephit dies, it leaves behind a cloud of smoke that fills a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Cinder Breath (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of smoldering ash. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mephit's next turn.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Divine Awareness
traits.text: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The solar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The solar makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Slaying Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die.

actions.name: Flying Sword
actions.text: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If the solar can see the sword, the solar can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to the solar's hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, the solar is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the solar dies.

actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
actions.text: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 (8d8 + 4) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Solar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Solar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.text: The solar magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The solar emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of its choice in a 10-foot radius must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Blinding Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The solar targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.text:
The spectator shoots up to two of the following magical eye rays at one or two creatures it can see within 90 feet of it. It can use each ray only once on a turn.

• 1. Confusion Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
• 2. Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 3. Fear Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spectator is visible to the target, ending the effect on itself on a success.
• 4. Wounding Ray. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

actions.name: Create Food and Water
actions.text: The spectator magically creates enough food and water to sustain itself for 24 hours.

name: Specter
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.text: ms +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 9 Constitution saving throw or take 2 (1d4) poison damage.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The devil doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Limited Spines
traits.text: The devil has twelve tail spines. Used spines regrow by the time the devil finishes a long rest.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The devil makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its fork or two with its tail spines.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (2d4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fork
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail Spine
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 20/80 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. On hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

actions.name: Heart Sight
actions.text: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 10 Charisma saving throw, the sprite also knows the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.text: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.text: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.text: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.text: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 feet of the mephit must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss.

The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. On hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Stone Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The giant can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. On hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Strike (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.text: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Charm
actions.text:
One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.

The fiend can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

actions.name: Draining Kiss
actions.text: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Etherealness

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reflective Carapace
traits.text: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Horns
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_actions.name: ​

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.text: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
