traits.text: The stone cursed has advantage on the attack rolls of opportunity attacks.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the stone cursed remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

actions.name: Petrifying Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage, or 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage if the attack roll had advantage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, or it begins to turn to stone and is restrained until the end of its next turn, when it must repeat the saving throw. The effect ends if the second save is successful; otherwise the target is petrified for 24 hours.

name: Stone Defender
languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the stone defender remains motionless against an uneven earthen or stone surface, it is indistinguishable from that surface.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The stone defender has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

traits.name: Fearsome Presence
traits.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Fey Step (recharge 4-6)
traits.text: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The eladrin makes two weapon attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

name: Sword Wraith Commander
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Martial Fury
traits.text: As a bonus action, the sword wraith can make one weapon attack, which deals an extra 9 (2d8) necrotic damage on a hit. If it does so, attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Turning Defiance
traits.text: The sword wraith and any other sword wraiths within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The sword wraith makes two weapon attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Call to Honor (1/Day)
actions.text: To use this action, the sword wraith must have taken damage during the current combat. If the sword wraith can use this action, it gives itself advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn, and 1d4 + 1 sword wraith warriors appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. The warriors last until they drop to 0 hit points, and they take their turns immediately after the commander's turn on the same initiative count.

name: Sword Wraith Warrior
languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Martial Fury
traits.text: As a bonus action, the sword wraith can make one weapon attack. If it does so, attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The Angry has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Rising Anger
traits.text:
If another creature deals damage to the Angry, the Angry's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage.

On its turn, the Angry has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Angry makes two hook attacks.

actions.name: Hook
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Life Hunger
traits.text: If a creature the Hungry can see regains hit points, the Hungry gains two benefits until the end of its next turn: it has advantage on attack rolls, and its bite deals an extra 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Hungry makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and is restrained until the grapple ends. While grappling a creature, the Hungry can't attack with its claws.

traits.name: Psychic Leech
traits.text: At the start of each of the Lonely's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Thrives on Company
traits.text: The Lonely has advantage on attack rolls while it is within 30 feet of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Lonely makes one harpoon arm attack and uses Sorrowful Embrace.

actions.name: Harpoon Arm
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. On hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature.

The Lonely has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.

actions.name: Sorrowful Embrace
actions.text: Each creature grappled by the Lonely must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the Lonely pulls each creature grappled by it up to 30 feet straight toward it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The Lost makes two arm spike attacks.

actions.name: Arm Spike
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Embrace
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is frightened, and it takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The Lost can embrace only one creature at a time.

traits.name: Wretched Pack Tactics
traits.text: The Wretched has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Wretched's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. The Wretched otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage, and the Wretched attaches to the target. While attached, the Wretched can't attack, and at the start of each of the Wretched's turns, the target takes 6 (1d10 + 1) necrotic damage.

The attached Wretched moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the Wretched's movement. The Wretched can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach a Wretched.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Titivilus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Titivilus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Titivilus's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Titivilus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Titivilus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Ventriloquism
traits.text: Whenever Titivilus speaks, he can choose a point within 60 feet; his voice emanates from that point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Titivilus makes one sword attack and uses his Frightful Word once.

actions.name: Silver Sword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage it takes.

actions.name: Frightful Word
actions.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the target must take the Dash action and move away from Titivilus by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: Titivilus magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

actions.name: Twisting Words
actions.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a DC 21 Charisma saving throw. On a failure the target is charmed for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw if Titivilus deals any damage to it. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Titivilus's Twisting Words for 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Titivilus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Titivilus regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Titivilus attacks with his silver sword or uses his Frightful Word.

legendary_actions.name: Corrupting Guidance
legendary_actions.text: Titivilus uses Twisting Words. Alternatively, he targets one creature charmed by him that is within 60 feet of him; that charmed target must make a DC 21 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, Titivilus decides how the target acts during its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.text: Titivilus uses his Teleport action.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +2 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

traits.name: Life Sense
traits.text: The mist can sense the location of any creature within 60 feet of it, unless that creature's type is construct or undead.

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.text: The mist can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Misty Form
traits.text: The mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The mist can't manipulate objects in any way that requires fingers or manual dexterity.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.text: The mist takes 10 radiant damage whenever it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.text: The mist touches one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed), or it takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, the mist regains 10 hit points, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Poison Splash
traits.text: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the creature is poisoned until the start of the troll's next turn.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Venom Spray (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a 15-foot cube. The troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). Each creature in the area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Corrupt Water
traits.text:
At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.

A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest.

If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Undertow
traits.text: As a bonus action when the wastrilith is underwater, it can cause all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The wastrilith uses Grasping Spout and makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Grasping Spout
actions.text: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
languages: one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The myrmidon makes three trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Freezing Strikes (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The abishai's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the abishai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The abishai makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its claw.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

traits.name: Fey Step (recharge 4-6)
traits.text: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.text:
Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The yagnoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The yagnoloth makes one massive arm attack and one electrified touch attack, or it makes one massive arm attack and teleports before or after the attack.

actions.name: Electrified Touch
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Massive Arm
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 23 (3d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or is stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.text: The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within 15 feet of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Battlefield Cunning (recharge 4-6)
actions.text: Up to two allied yugoloths within 60 feet of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The yagnoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Yeenoghu's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.text: When Yeenoghu reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on his turn, Yeenoghu can take a bonus action to move up to half his speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text:
Yeenoghu makes three flail attacks. If an attack hits, he can cause it to create an additional effect of his choice or at random (each effect can be used only once per Multiattack):

1. The attack deals an extra 13 (2d12) bludgeoning damage.

2. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

3. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

actions.name: Flail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (1d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (1d10 + 9) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Yeenoghu can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Yeenoghu regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Charge
legendary_actions.text: Yeenoghu moves up to his speed.

legendary_actions.name: Swat Away
legendary_actions.text: Yeenoghu makes a flail attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in a straight line away from Yeenoghu. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls prone.

legendary_actions.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Yeenoghu makes a bite attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

name: Young Kruthik
speed: walk 30 ft., burrow 10 ft., climb 30 ft.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The kruthik has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2 1/2-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Stab
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
traits.text:
As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.

The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is restrained, requiring a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become trapped.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The zaratan's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The zaratan makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stomp.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 26 (3d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock
actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +17 to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. On hit: 31 (6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spew Debris (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Zaratan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Zaratan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Stomp
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan makes one stomp attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Spit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan uses Spit Rock.

legendary_actions.name: Retract (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The zaratan emerges from its shell and uses Spit Rock. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Zariel's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Zariel's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 36 (8d8) fire damage (included in the weapon attacks below).

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Zariel regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Zariel attacks twice with her longsword or with her javelins. She can substitute Horrid Touch for one of these attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage, or 19 (2d10 + 8) slashing damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) piercing damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Horrid Touch (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or take 44 (8d10) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is also blinded and deafened. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: Zariel magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Zariel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Zariel regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.text: Zariel uses her Teleport action.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Zuggtmoy's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Zuggtmoy makes three pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day)
actions.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

actions.name: Mind Control Spores (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Humanoids and beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of Zuggtmoy for 24 hours. While infected in this way, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Zuggtmoy can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Zuggtmoy regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: Zuggtmoy makes one pseudopod attack.

legendary_actions.name: Exert Will
legendary_actions.text: One creature charmed by Zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as she directs or to make a weapon attack against a target that she designates.

name: Awakened Zurkhwood
languages: one language known by its creator

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal zurkhwood mushroom.

traits.name: Mute
traits.text: If the awakened zurkhwood was created by a myconid sovereign, it can't speak.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Fungus Stride
traits.text: Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within 5 feet and emerge from another within 60 feet of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

actions.name: Hallucination Spores
actions.text: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
actions.text: The bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

traits.name: Mushroom Portal
traits.text: The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

traits.name: Poison Spores
traits.text: Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within 5 feet of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The chamberlain makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
actions.text: The chamberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The spore servant makes two pincer attacks.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (Escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the spore servant doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

traits.name: (Optional) Indefinite Madness
traits.text: Horgar has been affected by the demon lords let loose in the Abyss during the Rage of Demons storyline. Roll on the Indefinite Madness table to determine Horgar's fla

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.text: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, Horgar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
traits.text: Horgar wields Gauntlets of Ogre Power giving him a Strength score of 19 (+4).

traits.name: Brave
traits.text: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: For 1 minute, Horgar magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Horgar is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Horgar lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: Horgar magically turns invisible until he attacks, casts a spell, or uses his Enlarge, or until his concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Horgar wears or carries is invisible with him.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Horgar makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: +2 Warhammer
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands. While Horgar is enlarged, the damage increases to 15 (2d8 + 6) or 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, respectively.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow

actions.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand Horgar. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Horgar is incapacitated.

name: Droki

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

traits.name: Insanity
traits.text: The Pudding King has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.text: The Pudding King magically transforms into an ooze, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. In ooze form, the Pudding King retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form.

actions.name: Create Green Slime (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.text: The Pudding King creates a patch of green slime (see "Dungeon Hazards" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). The slime appears on a section of wall, ceiling, or floor within 30 feet of the Pudding King.

traits.name: Chameleon Skin
traits.text: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

traits.name: Stench
traits.text: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with either its claws or its greatclub.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Acid Spray (recharge on 6)
actions.text: The troglodyte spits acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Vampiric Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Vampiric Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.text: Ranged weapon attack +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.text: If Yestabrod fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Caustic Spores (1/Day)
actions.text: Yestabrod releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of Yestabrod's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
actions.text: Yestabrod releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Yestabrod can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Yestabrod regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Corpse Burst
legendary_actions.text: Gore, offal, and acid erupt from a corpse within 20 feet of Yestabrod. Creatures within 10 feet of the corpse must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage.

legendary_actions.name: Foul Absorption
legendary_actions.text: Yestabrod absorbs putrescence from a corpse within 5 feet of it, regaining 1d8 + 2 hit points

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The thug makes two melee attacks

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.text: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

legendary_actions.name: Ram Attack

legendary_actions.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

If the target is prone, the serpopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite

traits.text: The homarid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the kavu moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the kavu can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The kavu makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Raking Charge
traits.text: If the kavu moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the kavu can make one rend attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rend
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. On hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) slashing damage.

name: Creepy Doll
languages: speaks and understands the languages known by its creator

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the creepy doll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate doll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The creepy doll makes one attack with its scissors and uses Psychic Assault.

actions.name: Scissors
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Psychic Assault
actions.text: The creepy doll targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it that has a brain. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage. Also on a failure, roll 3d6. If the total equals or exceeds the target's Intelligence score, that score is reduced to 0. The target is stunned until it regains at least one point of Intelligence, as from the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

actions.name: Body Exchange
actions.text:
The creepy doll initiates an Intelligence contest with an incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it. If it wins the contest, the creepy doll's spirit inhabits the target's body while the target's spirit is placed into the creepy doll's body. The creepy doll controls the target's body completely. It retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The target retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma while inhabiting the creepy doll's body.

The body exchange lasts until the doll's spirit is forced out by magic. (The dispel evil and good spell will accomplish this, though the doll is not one of the creature types whose possession that spell normally ends.) The body and the doll must be within 5 feet of each other for such an effect to work. The target is immune to this doll's Body Exchange for 24 hours after winning the Intelligence contest or after the exchange ends.

name: Geist
languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.text:
The geist can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when

it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text:
The geist can move through other creatures

and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force

damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Geist Powers
traits.text: Geists are as varied as the humans they were in life. In addition to the traits and actions all geists possess, an individual geist might have any of the following special characteristics.

traits.name: Geist Powers: Intangible Virtue
traits.text: A living creature possessed by a white-aligned geist gains immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. While the creature is possessed, the geist can allow it to take control of its body, but the geist can regain control at any time (no action required).

traits.name: Geist Powers: Horrifying Visage
traits.text: Black-aligned geists can make themselves terrible to behold, even when they are possessing the living. Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the geist that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this geist's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

actions.name: Withering Touch
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target On hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.text: The geist enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Possession (recharge on 6)
actions.text: One creature that the geist can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the geist; the geist then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The geist now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The geist can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the geist ends it as a bonus action, or the geist is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the geist reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this geist's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends. The geist can instead target the corpse of a creature, effectively using its own life force to animate the corpse as a zombie. The animated corpse uses zombie statistics and returns to death if the geist ends the possession.

name: Skaab
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Aversion of Fire
traits.text: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Skaab Characteristics
traits.text: The most basic skaabs are simply flesh golems, as described in the Monster Manual. But the aspiration of every skaberen is to produce a truly unique masterpiece, a goal that might see a stitcher create golems with one of the following special characteristics.

traits.name: Skaab Characteristic: Armor Plating
traits.text: Increase the skaab's Armor Class to 14 and increase its challenge rating to 6 (2,300 XP).

traits.name: Skaab Characteristic: Six Arms
traits.text: The skaab's multiattack action allows it to make three slam attacks. Increase its challenge rating to 6 (2,300 XP).

traits.name: Skaab Characteristic: Three Heads
traits.text: The skaab has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, and knocked unconscious. (Its challenge rating doesn't change.)

traits.name: Skaab Characteristic: Skaab Goliath
traits.text: This skaab has three heads, six arms, and armor plating. Increase its challenge rating to 7 (2,900 XP).

traits.name: Skaab Characteristic: Winged Skaab
traits.text: The skaab has a flying speed of 30 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. On hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. On hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Vampiric Glamer
actions.text: The vampire obscures its form with mind-affecting magic that makes others perceive it as a beautiful human of the same size and shape. The illusion ends if the vampire takes a bonus action to end it or if the vampire dies. A creature that can see the vampire can take an action to visually inspect it, ending the mental effect on itself and seeing the vampire's true form with a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Perception) check.

actions.name: Aura of Silence
actions.text: The vampire shrouds itself in a cloak of silence to a radius of 2 feet. Within that radius, the effect is the same as the silence spell.

name: Werewolf (Krallenhorde)
speed: walk 30 ft. (40 ft. in canid form)

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The werewolf polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid canid form, or back into its true human form. This change is dictated by the moon, but can also be induced by trauma or strong emotion. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.text: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Howlpack: Vildin
traits.text: Vildin Rampage (Canid Form Only). When the werewolf reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack (Canid Form Only)
actions.text: The werewolf makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

actions.name: Bite (Canid Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws (Canid Form Only)
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear (Human Form Only)
actions.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Aether Scent
traits.text: The gremlin can pinpoint, by scent, the location of refined or unrefined aether within 30 feet of it.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Siphon
actions.text:
The gremlin drains aether from an aether-powered device it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch automatically drains aether. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to keep it out of the gremlin's reach.

If the aether-powered device grants any bonus (to attack rolls, damage rolls, Armor Class, and so on), that bonus is reduced by 1. If the device has charges, it loses 1 charge. Otherwise, it stops functioning for 1 round. Left unhindered, a gremlin can completely destroy an aether-powered device.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 1 slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text:
Melee weapon attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the leviathan. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the leviathan, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the leviathan's turns.

If the leviathan takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the leviathan must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the leviathan. If the leviathan dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the chupacabra has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Drain Blood
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is prone, incapacitated, or restrained. On hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the chupacabra regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the elder dinosaur fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The elder dinosaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The elder dinosaur deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Uniqueness
traits.text: These statistics are shared by all six elder dinosaurs: Etali, Primal Storm, Ghalta, Primal Hunger, Nezahal, Primal Tide, Tetzimoc, Primal Death, Zacama, Primal Calamity, Zetalpa, Primal Dawn

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.text: Each creature of the elder dinosaur's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the elder dinosaur is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself ona success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elder dinosaur's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text: The elder dinosaur makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the elder dinosaur, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the elder dinosaur's turns. If the elder dinosaur takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of it. If the elder dinosaur dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Elder Dinosaur can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Elder Dinosaur regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: The elder dinosaur makes one claw attack, tail attack, wing attack, or flipper attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.text: The elder dinosaur moves up to half its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The elder dinosaur makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the elder dinosaur fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The elder dinosaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The elder dinosaur deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Lightning Storm
traits.text: The elder dinosaur is always accompanied by a raging thunderstorm similar to the effect of a call lightning spell. A storm cloud in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius instantly forms 100 feet in the air over the elder dinosaur when it is angered or becomes violent, as long as it is outdoors. On each of its turns, as an action, the elder dinosaur can choose a point it can see within 120 feet of it. A bolt of lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The elder dinosaur can use its Frightful Presence and call down two lightning strikes from its Lightning Storm. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the elder dinosaur can't bite another target.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: Gishath makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stomp or tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 39 (5d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or it is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Gishath can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.text:
Gishath makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Gishath, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of Gishath's turns.

If Gishath takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of it. If Gishath dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. On hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Gishath, Sun's Avatar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Gishath, Sun's Avatar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.text: Gishath makes one stomp or tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: Each creature that is within 120 feet of Gishath and can hear it must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on tself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Gishath's Roar for the next 24 hours.

name: Sunbird
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the sunbird dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried. The sunbird's body turns to ash, but an egg is left where the sunbird was.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.text: At the start of each of the sunbird's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) fire damage, and flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the sunbird or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) fire damage. The aura also sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The sunbird doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: The sunbird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The sunbird makes two talon attacks.

actions.name: Talon
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the sunbird can't attack another target with that talon. A grappled creature takes 11 (2d10) fire damage at the start of each of the sunbird's turns.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The archon's weapon attacks are magical. When the archon hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The archon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its understanding of justice.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The archon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: One Being
traits.text: Though it appears as a humanoid creature riding a mount, an archon is a single being. The "rider" can't be dismounted, and no other means can separate the two portions of the archon's being short of its death.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The archon makes two attacks: one with its sword and one with its claws.

actions.name: Sword
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.text: If the felidar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claws attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the felidar can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The felidar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The felidar's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The felidar makes two attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.text: The felidar touches another creature with its horns. The target magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target

actions.name: Teleport (1/Day)
actions.text: The felidar magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the felidar is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

legendary_actions.name: ​
legendary_actions.text: The Felidar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Felidar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Claws
legendary_actions.text: The felidar makes one attack with its claws.

legendary_actions.name: Shimmering Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The felidar creates a shimmering magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the felidar's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.text: The felidar magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The kraken makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its tentacles.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. On hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained.

actions.name: Lightning Strike (recharge 5-6)
actions.text: The kraken hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Animated
traits.text:
If the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the object is securely attached to a surface or larger object, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0.

When the animated object drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.

The DM might rule that a specific objects slam attack inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

actions.name: Slam
actions.text: Melee weapon attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On hit: 16 (2d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
